prompt:
You are given a variable called `question_paper_text`.

This variable refers to the full question paper.

Do NOT echo or restate it.

For each question, assign marks as given in the question paper, either given in brackets or against each question. Generate a numbered Scheme of Evaluation in the following format for ALL the questions in question_paper_text. :

For each question, output exactly these four sections:
Question number
Question text — copy each question verbatim from question_paper_text. If truncated or illegible, append “(incomplete in source)” at the end.
Answer template — bullet the minimum core ideas (or clear equivalents) in strict logical order needed for full credit. Use short, precise bullets. If a single correct answer is unambiguous (value/option/etc.), state it explicitly.
Marking scheme (Total = max_marks) — one bullet per core idea, labeled A, B, C in the same order as the Answer template. After each label, put the marks in square brackets, e.g. A [2], then a terse description of the expectation in context. Strictly limit the number of bullets to three.



The marks on A+B+C must sum exactly to max_marks printed in the paper. Ensure there are no errors in this. Recheck the marking scheme if required.



Integer-only per-bullet marks: The number inside each square bracket [ ] must be an integer (digits only)—no decimals/fractions (e.g., no [0.5], [1.0], ½). If finer granularity seems needed, restructure by confining to the most essential bullets in the answer.
Mini-example (for a 5-mark item)
Marking scheme (Total = 5)
 A [2]: states/defines core principle in this context
 B [2]: applies principle correctly to the given setup
 C [1]: computes/states final result with correct units/justification
Handling questions with sub-parts:
If a question has sub-parts (e.g. 1(a), 1(b), 1(c)) and each sub-part has its own marks printed in the paper, then treat each sub-part as a separate question.



Create a separate JSON object for each sub-part.
Use the sub-part label in Question number (e.g. "1(a)", "1(b)").
Apply all the same rules as for any other question (Answer template, Marking scheme with A/B/C bullets summing to that sub-part’s marks).
If a question has sub-parts but only one total mark is given for the whole question (no marks written against individual sub-parts), then treat it as a single question:
Keep one JSON object for the entire question.
The Question text should include all sub-parts (a, b, c, …).
The Marking scheme (Total = max_marks) must split the total marks across A, B, C bullets (integers, A+B+C = max_marks), focusing on the core ideas needed for full credit.
question_paper_text**IMPORTANT**: your **only** output must be a single JSON object (for single questions) or a JSON array of such objects (for batch), each with these keys:

Question number
Question text
Answer template
Marking scheme

Now generate a JSON array of mark-scheme objects for all questions in question_paper_text. Each object must have all the keys listed above.

Make sure you use only the file question_paper_text and give the response for all the questions in the question paper. Maintain the same question order as in question_paper_text. If a question has sub-parts, with their own marks, you will have multiple JSON objects with Question number like 1(a), 1(b) etc., but if the sub-parts do not have separate marks, keep a single JSON object for the whole question; do not split into ‘1(a)’, ‘1(b)’. Handle marks via bullets as per instructions earlier.

Before giving the final output, please check once again whether your generated content contains the mark scheme for ALL the questions. If it does not, please regenerate the mark scheme afresh based on the instructions in this prompt.

Required_input_variables
Question paper: {{extracted_questions}}
